title: Ticket #5645: Schedd EXCEPTs on job proxy update
description:
In 8.5.0, we made the permissions on jobs' directories under spool more restrictive by default (#4896). This broke the code in the schedd that accepts an updated proxy from a client. If the job's spool directory is chown'd between condor and the job owner (no longer done by default), the schedd needs to know which priv state to be in to write the proxy file. It does this by stat'ing the proxy file and looking at the ownership. With the restricted directory permissions, this will fail if the stat is done as the wrong user. The schedd doesn't notice the failure and EXCEPTs when it tries to use an uninitialized uid.

To fix, the schedd can stat the job's spool directory instead of the proxy file. Both should have the same ownership, and we know at this point in the code that the proxy file is in the spool directory.
